items.description: Upper Bristol Avon area
items.message:
River levels are currently falling but remain high. The level is currently below flood alert threshold but light showers today will keep levels high and the alert in force.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge.

Showers are forecast over the next few days and will keep river levels high at the Brokenborough gauge.

Please monitor local water levels and weather conditions and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

Refer to local authority website for road closures.

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 26/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Cherwell from Lower Heyford down to and including Oxford

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Cherwell, Woodeaton Brook, Bayswater Brook, Marston Brook, Peasmoor Brook

items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels are high but slowly falling on the lower River Cherwell. Therefore, flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue today, 25/10/24, especially in the Thrupp area. 
A band of rain is forecast to move through the region today, which has the potential to be heavy at times. This evening and overnight will be mainly dry. We expect river levels to continue to slowly fall over the next few days. River levels remain sensitive to rainfall.
We are monitoring the situation.  Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 26/10/24, or as the situation changes.

We are monitoring the situation. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 26/10/24, or as the situation changes.

A band of rain is forecast to move through the region today, which has the potential to be heavy at times. This evening and overnight will be mainly dry. items.description: Tern and Perry catchments
items.message:
River levels remain high but are falling at the Tern - Walcot river gauge.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem and Rodington. River levels at the Walcot river gauge are expected to fall below the flood risk threshold today, 25/10/2024. However, showers are forecast during the next 48 hours, which may cause river levels to rise above the flood risk threshold over the weekend.
We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 26/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Lugg south of Leominster
items.message: River levels remain high but steady at the Lugwardine river gauge following recent heavy rainfall. Levels have now fallen below flood risk threshold at the Butts Bridge and Ford Bridge river gauges. Flooding continues. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop.  Although showers are forecast during the next 48 hours they are not expected to increase river levels significantly. River levels have peaked but will remain high for several days.  We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.   This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, 26/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
Mid Bristol Avon area

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message:
The Flood Alert has now been removed.
Further light rainfall is forecast this afternoon but no further flooding is expected.
We will continue to monitor the situation and will reissue further alerts or warnings if necessary.
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Severn in Gloucestershire
items.message:
River levels remain high but continue to fall at the Mythe river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall and high spring tides. Consequently, the risk of flooding is reducing. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempsted, and Severn Ham, Tewkesbury.

No further significant rainfall is forecast.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.
This message will be updated by 10am on Sunday 27/10/2024, or if the situation changes.

A band of rain is forecast to move through the region today, which has the potential to be heavy at times. This evening and overnight will be mainly dry. items.description: River Thames and tributaries in the Oxford area
Lower Tone and Parrett Moors
Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to remain high and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No further rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.

items.description: River Ebble and tributaries
items.message:
High river levels throughout the afternoon may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible from 12:00 noon on 25/10/2024.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Ebble, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alvediston and Nunton.
Further flooding is possible throughout the afternoon as river levels continue to remain high due to raised groundwater levels.
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 3:00 PM on 28/10/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cranborne Chase area
items.message:
Groundwater levels have risen in response to recent rainfall. Levels are expected to continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. No rainfall is expected over the next few days.

Flooding of roads and fields is possible. Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.

Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. We will continue to monitor the situation closely.

This message will be updated by 16:00 PM on 29/10/2024.
